page.title: 10ASHDON ORGANISATIONS(cont.)
page.content: A branch of the Workers Educational Association was started in Ashdon in 1972.About 20 people attended the first open meeting and from this a group was formed.The purpose is to hold Educational classes for adults. Usually two 12 week courses are held each year-in the Autumn and the Spring.The subjects are voted for and the tutors usually come from Cambridge, or the nearly villages.The subjects studied have included music, ,art,literature,local history,history of London,Africa,China,America & East Anglian art & literature.Each course gives the students access to a wide choice of specialized library books & if possible,outings relevant to the course.The members vary according to their personal interests,but the classes usually consist of 20_24 members of mixed age & sex.
